name: ListLogs
description:
Retrieve logs based on a search query with pagination.

Use this tool to search and filter logs according to specified criteria. Note that results are paginated. Consider Datadog's archive capabilities for organizational log archiving needs.

parameters.name: minimum_time
parameters.description: The minimum time for the requested logs, supports date math and regular timestamps (milliseconds).

value_schema.description: The minimum time for the requested logs, supports date math and regular timestamps (milliseconds).

parameters.name: indexes_to_search
parameters.description: Specify the indexes to search. Defaults to ['*'] for all indexes.

value_schema.description: For customers with multiple indexes, the indexes to search. Defaults to ['*'] which means all indexes.

parameters.name: search_query
parameters.description: The search query following Datadog's log search syntax to filter logs.

value_schema.description: The search query - following the log search syntax.

parameters.name: storage_type
parameters.description: Specify the storage type: "indexes", "online-archives", or "flex".

value_schema.description: Specifies storage type as indexes, online-archives or flex

parameters.name: max_log_time
parameters.description: The maximum time for the requested logs. Supports date math and regular timestamps (milliseconds).

value_schema.description: The maximum time for the requested logs, supports date math and regular timestamps (milliseconds).

parameters.name: time_offset_seconds
parameters.description: The time offset in seconds to apply to the log search query.

value_schema.description: The time offset (in seconds) to apply to the query.

parameters.name: query_timezone
parameters.description: Specify the timezone as GMT, UTC, an offset (e.g., UTC+1), or a Timezone Database ID (e.g., America/New_York).

value_schema.description: The timezone can be specified as GMT, UTC, an offset from UTC (like UTC+1), or as a Timezone Database identifier (like America/New_York).

parameters.name: pagination_cursor
parameters.description: Cursor for retrieving the next set of paginated log results from a previous query.

value_schema.description: List following results with a cursor provided in the previous query.

parameters.name: maximum_logs_in_response
parameters.description: Specifies the maximum number of logs to return in the response, allowing control over pagination size.

value_schema.description: Maximum number of logs in the response.

parameters.name: sort_order
parameters.description: Defines how logs are sorted: 'timestamp' for ascending order and '-timestamp' for descending order.

value_schema.description: Sort parameters when querying logs.

metadata.description: Tools that enable LLMs to interact directly with the Datadog API.

parameters.name: filter.from
parameters.description: The minimum time for the requested logs, supports date math and regular timestamps (milliseconds).

value_schema.description: The minimum time for the requested logs, supports date math and regular timestamps (milliseconds).

parameters.name: filter.indexes
parameters.description: For customers with multiple indexes, the indexes to search. Defaults to ['*'] which means all indexes.

value_schema.description: For customers with multiple indexes, the indexes to search. Defaults to ['*'] which means all indexes.

parameters.name: filter.query
parameters.description: The search query - following the log search syntax.

value_schema.description: The search query - following the log search syntax.

parameters.name: filter.storage_tier
parameters.description: Specifies storage type as indexes, online-archives or flex

value_schema.description: Specifies storage type as indexes, online-archives or flex

parameters.name: filter.to
parameters.description: The maximum time for the requested logs, supports date math and regular timestamps (milliseconds).

value_schema.description: The maximum time for the requested logs, supports date math and regular timestamps (milliseconds).

parameters.name: options.timeOffset
parameters.description: The time offset (in seconds) to apply to the query.

value_schema.description: The time offset (in seconds) to apply to the query.

parameters.name: options.timezone
parameters.description: The timezone can be specified as GMT, UTC, an offset from UTC (like UTC+1), or as a Timezone Database identifier (like America/New_York).

value_schema.description: The timezone can be specified as GMT, UTC, an offset from UTC (like UTC+1), or as a Timezone Database identifier (like America/New_York).

parameters.name: page.cursor
parameters.description: List following results with a cursor provided in the previous query.

value_schema.description: List following results with a cursor provided in the previous query.

parameters.name: page.limit
parameters.description: Maximum number of logs in the response.

value_schema.description: Maximum number of logs in the response.

parameters.name: sort
parameters.description: Sort parameters when querying logs.

value_schema.description: Sort parameters when querying logs.
